sentences.sContent: When the play's star broke her leg her understudy wept crocodile tears.
sentences.sContent_eng: When the play's star broke her leg her understudy wept crocodile tears.
sentences.sCn: 当这部剧的主演摔坏了腿时，她的替角流下了鳄鱼的眼泪。

sentences.sContent: While the star is recuperating from her illness, her role will be played by her understudy.
sentences.sContent_eng: While the star is recuperating from her illness, her role will be played by her understudy.
sentences.sCn: 当明星正在休养恢复健康时，她的角色由修补演员代替。

trans.tranOther: to be an understudy for a particular actor in a play
an actor who learns a part in a play so that they can act the part if the usual actor is ill
